article_node.title: Former Texas WR Isaiah Bond cleared of charges, announces heâ€™s joining Browns
article_node.summary: Isaiah Bond, a former Texas Longhorns wide receiver, has been cleared of sexual assault charges by a Collin County grand jury, allowing him to pursue his NFL career. Following the decision, Bond expressed gratitude towards the Cleveland Browns for the opportunity to continue playing football, maintaining his innocence throughout the allegations. Despite being regarded as a potential Day 2 pick in the NFL Draft, Bond went undrafted due to the pending investigation but is now eligible to sign with any team.
